definition: Philosophical and methodological frameworks for teaching and facilitating learning

positive_examples: Our school follows a constructivist approach where students build their own understanding.
The Montessori method emphasizes self-directed activity and hands-on learning.
We've adopted project-based learning as our primary pedagogical framework.
The Socratic method uses questioning to stimulate critical thinking.
negative_examples: The test scores improved this semester.
Students completed their homework on time.
The classroom had thirty desks arranged in rows.
training_hints.disambiguation: Overarching teaching philosophy, not specific techniques or outcomes

simplex_mapping.mapping_rationale: Pedagogical approaches vary in how much autonomy they grant learners
